judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION
OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006
IN
PETITION NO.14 OF 1975 
Re: Purshottamdas H. Motreja
..Insolvent.
Ex-parte:
Bhavandas S. Wadhwani
..Petitioning Creditor.
...
Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.
CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J.
 21st November, 2006.
P.C. :
An order of adjudication was passed on 19th March,
. The schedule of assets and liabilities filed by the Insolvent
on 19th August, 1975 shows fifteen unsecured creditors to the tune
of Rs.2,01,824/-. On 7th July, 1992 the insolvency was annulled
under Rule 136 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, 1910 subject to
realisation of the property of the insolvent. At present Rs.1,352.52
is lying to the credit of the estate account. In the present case, no
further recoveries are possible. The Official Assignee has prayed
that this amount may be transferred to the unclaimed dividend
capital account under Rule 178 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules,
and thereafter to the unclaimed dividend capital revenue
account and the account may be closed for administrative
purposes. Having regard to the circumstances set out in the report
of the Official Assignee, there is no reason why the prayer should
not be granted. Prayer clause (a) of the report of the Official
Assignee is accordingly granted.
